subject: Education
title: Stereotype Threat and Test Performance
description: A 60-second lesson on Stereotype Threat and Test Performance.

hook.text: Remind women of their gender before a math test and their scores drop. Don't mention it, and they match men.

buildup.text: Claude Steele's research showed that activating negative stereotypes impairs test performance.

discovery.text: Stereotype threat consumes working memoryâ€”anxiety about confirming a stereotype leaves fewer resources for thinking.

twist.text: Simply framing a test as 'diagnostic of ability' triggers threat; calling it 'a puzzle' eliminates it.

climax.text: Millions of test scores may underestimate ability for groups targeted by stereotypes.

punchline.text: Sometimes the test doesn't measure what you knowâ€”it measures what you fear.

quiz.question: How does stereotype threat impair test performance?
options: It consumes working memory through anxiety, leaving fewer resources for the task
It causes students to physically leave the testing room
It only affects students with low ability
